page.title: 01Parbold-Hilldale Lancs.
page.content: A mainly rural area with much farmland some woodland,private housing estates near to Parbold centre and Hilldale. Other houses are old,some converted from old barns,a Smithy and Stores at Bispham.Small dairy farms with cereal crops are scattered around the area. The Council is preserving an area where people can picnic,and rebuilding an old Windmill.The main road passing through Parbold and Bispham is B5246, other narrow,winding roads have hedges or grass verges at the side.Footpaths are clearly marked to viewpoints,farms and hamlets.On a clear day Southport is seen and Blackpool Tower is visible. Quarrying stopped 2 years ago.There is only 1 Primary School,1 post office,1 chapel,1 garage but 5 Public Houses/ Restaurants.The River Douglas and the railway line from Southport to Wigan run through south-west Parbold.
